frameDefinitions: The Lender gives the Theme to the Borrower with the expectation that the Borrower will return the Theme to the Lender after a Duration of time.
A Lessor who owns some Goods allows a Lessee to use the Goods temporarily in exchange for Money.
A Donor transfers a Theme from a Donor to a Recipient.
The words in this frame describe the process of making amends for some (wrongful) action (the Injury) committed by the Wrongdoer.
An Agent manipulates an Instrument in order to achieve a Purpose.
frameExamples: I am <t>lending</t> a student of mine my book on German modal particles.
For cold conditions, we recommend that you <t>use</t> a heat gun or a hair dryer to make the adhesive work better.
listRoleDefinitions: The person or institution who receives the <fen>Theme</fen> from the <fen>Lender</fen> for a <fen>Duration</fen>.
The person or institution who gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Borrower</fen> for a <fen>Duration</fen>.
The object that is transferred from the <fen>Lender</fen> to the <fen>Borrower</fen> for a <fen>Duration</fen>.
The time when the lending event occurs.
The location in which the Lender lends the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Borrower</fen>.
The <fen>Lessee</fen> has <fen>Money</fen> and wants the <fen>Goods</fen>.
The role <fen>Goods</fen> is the item which is temporarily exchanged for <fen>Money</fen>.
The <fen>Lessor</fen> has possession of the <fen>Goods</fen> and temporarily exchanges them for <fen>Money</fen> from a <fen>Lessee</fen>.
The time at which the renting takes place.
The location where the leasing takes place.
The person that begins in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen> and causes it to be in the possession of the <fen>Recipient</fen> .
The entity that ends up in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The object that changes ownership.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Donor</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Donor</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The <fen>Injured_party</fen> was affected by some previous wrongful act of the <fen>Wrongdoer</fen> and who should benefit from the reparations.
The <fen>Injury</fen> is the injurious action that  the <fen>Wrongdoer</fen> committed against the <fen>Injured_party</fen>.  Although conceptually present, this role need not always be realized.
The <fen>Wrongdoer</fen> makes amends to the <fen>Injured_party</fen> for the <fen>Injury</fen>.
The <fen>Benefiting_action</fen> is performed by the <fen>Wrongdoer</fen> to make amends.
<fen>Gift</fen> identifies the entity that the <fen>Wrongdoer</fen> gives to the <fen>Injured_party</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when amends are made.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Wrongdoer</fen> makes amends.
The Agent uses the Instrument to achieve their Purpose.
This role identifies the purpose for which an Agent uses the Instrument.
An entity directed by the <fen>Agent</fen> that serves to bring about the <fen>Purpose</fen> of the <fen>Agent</fen>.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> uses the <fen>Instrument</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the Agent uses the Instrument.
listRoleExamples: I lent the book <fex>to him</fex> for a whole month, and he still hasn't read it.
<fex>I</fex> lent the book to him for a whole month, and he still hasn't read it.
I lent <fex>the book</fex> to him for a whole month, and he still hasn't read it.
I lent him my car <fex>on Friday</fex>.
I lent him my book <fex>in Dubai</fex>.
So far, <fex>my company</fex> has rented the video more than three million times .
You can never make amends <fex>to Susan</fex> for standing her up.
Wyelander sought reparations <fex>for the brutal murder of his nephew</fex>.
How  can <fex>I</fex> make it up to you?
Between friends, amends can be made <fex>by apologizing</fex>.
He made it up to her <fex>with a bouquet of flowers</fex>.
He made amends to her <fex>that very afternoon</fex>.
Restitution was given <fex>in Milan</fex> with the Treaty of Abiselle.
For cold conditions, we recommend using <fex>a heat gun or a hair dryer</fex> to make the adhesive work better.
I went and used that ball <fex>yesterday</fex> and i bowled 5 games and i left about 14 ten pins with it.
